 Depositing DLC (diamond-like-carbon) with various platinum concentration using pulsed laser deposition

 Determining the hardness using scratch test procedure, specifically using +CSM Instruments Micro-Scratch Tester.

 Summary of Thesis: It is observed and analyzed that as concentration of platinum increases within the DLC sample, the material softens. summary:
Colex was established in 1972, concentrating on photographic equipment in the early years. We manufactured more than 6,000 photo processors up to 80” wide for the U.S. market and exporting to more than 50 countries. Due to changes in the marketplace, Colex adjusted its product line and now thrives in the booming wide format printing industry.

 We service what we sell, always paying attention to our customer’s needs. “Affordable to buy, affordable to own” is our motto. Our products are reasonably priced and designed to provide you with the best value in the industry. Colex does not subject our customers to expensive service contracts as our equipment is designed for low maintenance.

 Colex is headquartered in Paramus, NJ with easy access to all NY airports, offering our customers the opportunity to see and test our equipment for their specific applications and requirements.

 Colex takes great pride in our products and offers the highest level of service to each customer.
 Colex specializes in equipment for the finishing department in the Wide Format Cutting industry. Colex is the exclusive dealer in North America for FOTOBA X/Y Cutters and the manufacturers of the new COLEX Flatbed Cutter, powered by I-CUT.

 Colex Imaging, Inc. was founded by Werner Waden in 1972 as a distributor of photographic products throughout the United States. Colex became a manufacturer of photographic processors in 1988 selling more than 6,000 processing machines in over 50 countries.

 With the demise of photographic media due to the digital revolution, Colex is now marketing equipment for innovative solutions for the finishing department of the Wide Format Printers. Colex offers Flatbed Cutters, Digital Cutters, Wide Formats Cutters, Vinyl Cutters, X/Y cutters and many other Cutting Equipments.

summary:
Erik possesses strong analytical and planning skills, the ability to coordinate the efforts of many to meet organizational goals, has productive and efficient work habits without supervision, and is a self-motivator with high energy.

 Erik is a professional front-end designer and developer specializing in Drupal. He is known for his professionalism in delivering solutions to clients, employing a thorough approach of deconstructing large issues into smaller, more easily solved tasks. Erik helped develop the "Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Winners Network." Over the course of 18 months, Erik helped rebuild and redesign a private social media network for the globe’s largest community of entrepreneurs.

 Erik’s passions include learning; this allows him to be on the cutting-edge of front-end design and development, provide the most relevant and sustainable solutions to his clients, and share knowledge and experiences gained along the way with other designers and developers. He also has a passion for open-source community building and teaching - he also presents at most Drupal-related events that he attends.

 Erik is a Florida native, and currently resides in Portland, Oregon. For the last four years, Erik and his husband have been traveling the world as digital nomads.

 Erik has been a Drupal community member for over 6 years, engaging the community from the very start. He has been a professional web site designer and developer for over 10 years. He provides private front-end development training to clients as well as presenting at Drupal events all over the world.

 Erik presents at Drupal events of all sizes, including local meetup groups, regional camps, and national conventions. He normally presents on front-end development topics, but has also spoken on the topic of community involvement and organization. He has also provided classroom-style front-end development training at various regional tech events.

projects.description: We’re a non-profit building a community of moms to tackle the issues only a mom is brave enough to take on. The world is changing, our country is changing – we all sense it, especially mothers. Our children face things today that threaten their health and safety: bullying, body image issues, school violence, drugs, internet safety, etc.. What can we as moms DO to fix all this? We can do a lot – and we can do it most effectively TOGETHER. Who better to solve the social issues our kids face than the moms who love them? We may not be soldiers on the front lines, but we are soldiers nonetheless, fighting for our children’s lives; fighting to keep our kids healthy, sane, happy, safe. Moms, you’re invited to participate in productive, effective discussions around understanding and solving the social problems our children face. Participate in our online community, utilize our directory of resources, watch our podcast, start a crowd-funding campaign, or even run for political office! The hand that rocks the cradle is the hand that rules the world.

publications.title: Self Promotion Sucks (But It Doesn't Have To)
publications.summary: Co-authored with 40 other awesome entrepreneurs. Self-Promotion Sucks tackles the tough topics that plague the entrepreneurial spirit. From crafting a plan of action to building a community around your brand, this eBook is a comprehensive guide to making Self-Promotion a whole helluva lot less painful. Written by a gaggle of geniuses who have been there/done that: Akira Morita, Amanda Abella, Amber Adams, Annie Passanisi, Barry Lewis Green, Brandy Morris, ChaChanna Simpson, Chris Schenk, Dana Sitar, Dave Ursillo, David Dye, Diana Antholis, El Edwards, Erin Muldoon Stetson, Ian Webster, Ji Eun (Jamie) Lee, Jasmine Patten, Jennie Mustafa-Julock, Kara Martin Snyder, Karyn Osinowo, Kent Gustavson, Kim Jennings, Lisa Landtroop, Lori Paquette, Luz Donahue, Mark Powers, Megan Atkinson, Michelle Shea Walker, Nick Conrad, Rhiannon Llewellyn, Sarah Arrow, Seth Perler, Sierra Dufault, Stephen Fisher, Stephen White, Susan Newman, Tami Evans, Tami Mathisen, Tess Strand, and Yolanda Facio under the editing eye of Kevin Whiteley. - Prepare yourself and your brand for all the uncomfortable feelings that come allong with peddling your wares. - Know when to take advice from others and what marketing noise to ignore. - Polish your message and your mission for getting the exposure and eyeballs you so deserve. - Promote your products and services without feeling like a sleazy used car salesman. - Gain insight into the nitty-gritty of the Self-Promotion process and how to make your plan sustainable. - Market and sell your genius live and in person, without wanting to puke. - Create connections with your right audience, build your tribe, and collaborate with bigness. - Discover the inner workings of your entrepreneurial brain and what is standing in your way. - Get the skinny on precisely how and where to share your story for maximum impact.

Available in paperback, PDF eBook, and Kindle edition: teaches small business owners and entrepreneurs how to find, hire, and effectively work with a professional virtual assistant including: the best places to find a virtual assistant online; how to submit an RFP (Request for Proposal) that gets results; the ten most important questions to ask a prospective VA; tips on how to delegate; the difference between a professional virtual assistant and an offshore VA call center. Also includes a directory of 50 online tools and resources business owners can use to make working virtually easier, more efficient, and more effective.

headline: Owner- at Magers Products
summary:
I started model making for the toy industry in 1990 after trying my hand in the culinary arts business. It turns out that I like to eat more than I like to cook. As luck would have it my father had been designing toys for more than 20 years and needed some help. I have had a passion for all things mechanical since I was young. Taking things apart to see how they work was endless fun.
 In middle school, a local bike shop hired me part time, building and repairing bicycles. After 15+ years of running the repair department, I thought it was time to try something new. Though my love of bicycles has diminished some with age, I still marvel at the simple mechanics and the joy it brings to many.
 I ventured out on my own in 2007 and haven't looked back.
 I have been designing and building mechanical prototypes for over 20 years and have amassed a sizable knowledge of how things work. This ranges from being able to manipulate plastics, light machining, molding in different mediums, and fabrications. To build a working prototype from a simple drawing or verbal description has been a difficult skill to master. Development is not an exact science, and can take time, and trial and error to get things to work in their intended way.
 I am a one man operation who develops all prototypes in house and by hand. Everything is done as a one-of-a-kind item and if multiples are required molds will need to be made. Sadly I do not have the capability of programming electronics.

Chandler Monitoring Systems is an innovative applications company whose goal is to utilize our experience and talent to bring fiber optic monitoring systems to the forefront of any industry seeking to expand their products and services. Through the power of imagination and the integration of diverse optical sensing equipment and products, we offer the most current, state of the art turnkey monitoring systems and solutions to an unlimited number of industries and applications. Today, you can find widespread Optical Sensing deployments in Structural, Civil, Power, Transportation, Aerospace and Security industries. The maturity of the solution is proven and the effort to educate all industries is well underway in many countries across the world and a key goal for Chandler Monitoring Systems.

 Fiber Optical Sensing has come a long way and continues to prove itself as a reliable medium for the collection of technical data and measurements. CMS creates a customized design for each project that utilizes the industry’s most efficient and reliable components and software to create a sound and competitive system for each company or organization that we work with. The information and abilities supplied by the components and equipment in this field far supersede those of conventional sensors. CMS has proven this through our Structural Health Monitoring Systems that utilize the connectivity and diversity of various optical sensory gages and equipment that have been utilized in many fields and the many other projects currently underway.

 In addition to the design consultation that we offer, CMS also provides training services for organizations that wish to maintain and monitor their customized system with their own personnel. We are proud to provide demonstrations and webinars in order to educate a company interested in using our applications.

 Specialties:Fiber Optics

experience.description: I worked as a Level II Systems Engineer for development, integration, and testing of the Mission System Trainer (MST) for the MQ-8B Fire Scout unmanned aerial vehicle. I was responsible for employing and ensuring the success of the systems engineering “V” process for the MQ-8B MST acquisition from initial capabilities decomposition through design and integration and into verification, validation, testing, and acceptance. I was an integral member of Integrated Product Development Team (IPT) charged with the responsibility to acquire and develop training solutions for the Unmanned Air Systems (UAS) program, which included Fire Scout, BAMS, and UCLASS platforms. I employed concurrent training and weapon system development processes to provide a rapid deployment timeline to ensure products were delivered to the fleet as timely as possible. Training solutions ranged from contractor provided services to organic steady state solutions requiring entire program development including simulators, devices, and training content for multi-decade service. I was involved in Systems Engineering Technical Review (SETR) processes which included tailoring, teaching, and scoring SETR checklists; and was responsible for reviewing contractor deliverables throughout the acquisition process. I developed and reviewed performance specifications, statements of work, risk items, and System Engineering Plan (SEP). I created Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM) mapping high-level Capability Production Document (CPD) requirements to performance level requirements. I produced Integrated Master Schedules (IMSs) to keep key technical milestones on schedule. I supported Test & Evaluation (T&E) in creating the Test and Evaluation Master Plan (TEMP). While working as a Quality Assurance evaluator, I reviewed proposals from 30+ contracting agencies, evaluated the Quality Assurance portion of proposals, and provided detailed analysis of quality assurance management plans from various agencies.

projects.description: Our project is a synthesis and analysis of small and large-scale energy saving measures in the town of Rutland. Working with Green Mountain Power (GMP) and Efficiency Vermont, we collected average electricity consumption data for Rutland as well as the energy saving potential of common home energy upgrades. Utilizing this data, we conducted two related an analyses; citywide energy consumption maps and a home efficiency cost curve. We created two representations of the same dynamic, one on an individual scale and the other encompassing an entire community. Our hope was to create complimentary visualizations to encourage citizens of the fair city of Rutland to consider the environmental and economic benefits that energy efficiency upgrades can create.
projects.title: City of Rutland Energy Useage and Efficiency Audit

experience.description: The purpose of an accident/incident investigation includes: Help determine legal requirement(s) followed and/or implemented at time of accident or incident Help to establish the root cause and provide grounds to implement hazard controls to prevent re-occurrences An accident is an undesired event that results in physical harm to a person or damage to property. An incident is an undesired event that could (or does) downgrade the efficiency of the business operation or, if the circumstances had been different, it may have resulted in an accident. It should always be considered practical to conduct an accident investigation for all accidents and incidents however legislation indicates that only accidents that result in a critical injury or death need to be investigated. The members of an investigative committee shall designate one or more members to investigate cases where a worker is killed or critically injured in the workplace. Committee members may inspect the actual place where the accident occurred and any machine, device or thing that may be associated with the event, and shall report his or her findings to the committee.
experience.title: AWP Accident Investigative Consultant

 Related AWP Industry Documents & Publications:

publications.summary: "The fullest account yet of the rise of one of the most profitable, most powerful, and oddest businesses the world has ever seen." - San Francisco Chronicle Just eleven years old, Google has profoundly transformed the way we live and work-we've all been Googled. Esteemed media writer Ken Auletta uses the story of Google's rise to explore the future of media at large. This book is based on the most extensive cooperation ever granted a journalist, including access to closed-door meetings and interviews with industry legends, including Google founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin, Marc Andreessen, and media guru "Coach" Bill Campbell. Auletta's unmatched analysis, vivid details, and rich anecdotes illuminate how the Google wave grew, how it threatens to drown media institutions, and where it's taking us next.
publications.title: Googled: The End of the World As We Know It

publications.summary: "One mark of a great book is that it makes you see things in a new way, and Mr. Friedman certainly succeeds in that goal," the Nobel laureate Joseph E. Stiglitz wrote in The New York Times reviewing The World Is Flat in 2005. In this new edition, Thomas L. Friedman includes fresh stories and insights to help us understand the flattening of the world. Weaving new information into his overall thesis, and answering the questions he has been most frequently asked by parents across the country, this third edition also includes two new chapters–on how to be a political activist and social entrepreneur in a flat world; and on the more troubling question of how to manage our reputations and privacy in a world where we are all becoming publishers and public figures.
publications.title: The World is Flat 3.0 / A Brief History of the Twenty-First Century

publications.summary: Recovery? What Recovery? Did you lose money in the stock market in the last financial crisis of late 2008? Has your home lost value? Are you "underwater" in your mortgage or concerned about selling? Do your dollars buy less than they used to at the grocery store and the gas pump? Have you lost your job or know someone who did?
publications.title: AFTERSHOCK - Protect Yourself and Profit in the Next Global Financial Meltdown

publications.summary: “A superb analysis of the crisis in the Midwest and sober advice on how to alleviate, if not eliminate, the region’s pain…Caught in the Middle provides a brilliant battle plan.”—Chicago Tribune The Midwest has always been the heart of America—both its economic bellwether and the repository of its national identity. Now, in a newly globalized age, the Midwest is challenged as never before. In Caught in the Middle, longtime Chicago Tribune reporter Richard Longworth explores the new reality of life in today’s heartland and reveals what these changes mean for the region—and the country.
publications.title: Caught in the Middle: America's Heartland in the Age of Globalism

publications.summary: Decision Points is the extraordinary account of America's 43rd president. Shattering the conventions of political autobiography, George W. Bush offers a strikingly candid journey through the defining decisions of his life. In gripping, never-before-heard detail, President Bush brings readers inside the Texas Governor's Mansion on the night of the hotly contested 2000 election; aboard Air Force One on 9/11, in the hours after America's most devastating attack since Pearl Harbor; at the head of the table in the Situation Room in the moments before launching the war in Iraq; and behind the Oval Office desk for his historic and controversial decisions on the financial crisis, Hurricane Katrina, Afghanistan, Iran, and other issues that have shaped the first decade of the twenty-first century. President Bush writes honestly and directly about his flaws and mistakes, as well as his accomplishments reforming education, treating HIV/AIDS in Africa, and safeguarding the country amid chilling warnings of additional terrorist attacks. He also offers intimate new details on his decision to quit drinking, discovery of faith, and relationship with his family. Decision Points will captivate supporters, surprise critics, and change perspectives on one of the most consequential eras in American history—and the man at the center of events.
publications.title: Decision Points

publications.summary: To say that Jesus of Nazareth was the most influential man who ever lived is almost trite. Nearly two thousand years after he was brutally executed by Roman soldiers, more than 2.2 billion human beings attempt to follow his teachings and believe he is God. That includes 77 percent of the U.S. population, according to a Gallup Poll. The teachings of Jesus have shaped the entire world and continue to do so. - See more at: http://killingjesusthebook.com/#sthash.wdXjQfSK.dpuf
publications.title: Killing Jesus

publications.summary: If God is all powerful and full of love, why doesn't He do something about the pain and evil in our world? This book answers that age old question with startling creativity and staggering clarity. By far one of the best books I have ever read.
publications.title: The Shack

publications.summary: The Conflict of the Ages in the Christian Dispensation
publications.title: The Great Controversy - ended ..... a Glimpse into Eternity

publications.summary: The Desire of Ages is a proven source of inspiration and enlightenment to millions of readers all over the world. And with good reason, for it deals with a universal yearning—the desire for living life to its fullest with the knowledge that we are here for a reason. That we are loved. This devotional classic tells the life story of the greatest spiritual leader the world has ever known—Jesus Christ. It does not merely set down a series of remote events; it presents the meaning of them so vividly that you will feel like you are an eyewitness to what is being described. And in these pages you will understand, possibly for the first time, the true, underlying significance of Christ's deeds and their bearing on your own life . . . here and now. This book is like a harmony of the gospels. It takes Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John and combines the stories in chapter form. Of the thousands of books in the Library of Congress on the life of Jesus, this is one of the most used and asked for.
publications.title: The Desire of Ages

publications.summary: General George S. Patton, Jr. died under mysterious circumstances in the months following the end of World War II. For almost seventy years, there has been suspicion that his death was not an accident--and may very well have been an act of assassination. Killing Patton takes readers inside the final year of the war and recounts the events surrounding Patton’s tragic demise, naming names of the many powerful individuals who wanted him silenced.
publications.title: Killing Patton: The Strange Death of World War II's Most Audacious General

publications.summary: Is it possible that there exists a three-thousand-year-old mystery that… · Has been determining the course of your life without your knowing it? · Foretells current events before they happen? · Revealed the dates and the hours of the greatest crashes in Wall Street history before they happened? · And more….
publications.title: The Mystery of the Shemitah: The 3,000-Year-Old Mystery That Holds the Secret of America's Future

publications.summary: Is it possible... That there exists an ancient mystery that holds the secret of America's future? That this mystery lies behind everything from 9/11 to the collapse of the global economy? That ancient harbingers of judgment are now manifesting in America? That God is sending America a prophetic message of what is yet to come?
publications.title: The Harbinger

I am a member of our office's accounting team. I assist in gathering and organizing documentation for our customers, auditing and entering data for invoicing in a timely manner, and working with our partner carriers to ensure proper documents are filed and procedure is followed. I pride myself in ensuring our information is both detailed and accurate. I also assist our office’s operations team, entering information to set up shipments for our customers as well as tracking their freight to ensure a timely and smooth arrival to its destination. Anything I can do in the office to help, I am more than happy to jump in and do what I can. I will never say, “That’s not my job”, because it takes team effort for any business to succeed. headline: Bilingual Resource Specialist
recommendations_preview: Across the two and a half years I have known Julia, and worked with her, she has demonstrated herself to be a highly motivated, highly strategic and incredibly creative self-starter. She has an entrepreneurial spirit and is very dependable and flexible. I had the pleasure of working with Julia when I was directing the annual fundraising campaign for the Konojel Nutrition Center in San Marcos La Laguna, Guatemala. Julia was brought onboard to handle graphic design for the center and for the fundraising campaign, and it quickly became apparent that her strategic contribution would also be an invaluable asset to the team. I observed Julia interpret client briefs into visual concepts such as brochures, posters and logos, and demonstrate a strong willingness to come to the table with different creative approaches. Throughout the planning process, Julia's voice was instrumental, strong, and diplomatic in communication and fundraising strategy discussions. I was especially impressed when Julia strategically conceived of social media mechanisms, such as customized "thank you" graphics to post on each participant's and donor's wall with a strong copy line, that exponentially increased reach of our campaign. Not only did Julia proactively create these items in addition to briefed material, but she also came to the team with the creative solution already worked up. She gave the campaign a strong visual identity, and helped us achieve more than double our previous year's fundraising. She showed both sharp responsiveness and leadership. While I worked directly with Julia on Konojel, I can also attest to witnessing the same dedication, creativity and social leadership across many community projects. Julia's ability to integrate and impact the local community of Mayan descent was outstanding and her commitment to making a social contribution apparent. She taught children to speak new languages, inspired adults to bring out their creativity again, and helped local women turn skills into crafts that could promote their independence and welfare. Julia holds a diverse and impressive set of talents, skills, ambitions and social abilities that will be an incredible advantage to anyone who has the good fortune to employ her. Sincerely, Aimee Hansen

Julia is a pleasure to work alongside, always bringing a fresh perspective and a warm laugh. She is dedicated, very talented, open-minded and is willing to do what it takes to get a job done well and on time. While I worked with Julia she managed many diverse roles and projects and in many ways held the school together through the strength of her organizational and communication skills. I look forward to working with Julia again some time!

projects.description: Nimbula Director is a cloud operating system software solution that allows users to implement IaaS (infrastructure as a service) style private, public and hybrid clouds. The software is aimed at both enterprise customers and service providers. It can manage both on- and off-premise infrastructure through a Web UI, an API or a command line interface.
projects.title: Nimbula, Inc. (Link)

projects.description: The main idea of the project is to provide customer with a simple to use FTP to Amazon S3 proxy service. End user can use any standard FTP client to store or retrieve objects from/to Amazon S3. To start using the FTP2S3, customer should launch the Cloud Formation template, specifying the desired S3 bucket name and FTP server users’ credentials. No explicit AWS credentials required, authorization on S3 is implemented with Amazon IAM Roles through the instance configuration using the Cloud Formation template. FTP2S3 server is a multi-threaded stand-alone java application that relies on the Apache FTP server (Mina project) and Amazon Java SDK integration. Project team consists of 3 people: java developer (main project functionality development), automation QA engineer (functional and load testing), maintenance engineer (Cloud Formation template and custom machine image creation.) Personal contribution: main project functionality development. Technology stack: • Java • Apache FTP server with NIO listeners (Mina project) • Amazon Java SDK • JCommander • Spring Framework • Maven • Amazon Cloud Formation template • Custom AWS Machine Image (possibly on AWS Marketplace) The FTP2S3 server’s design load is 100 simultaneous connections if launching the server on the m1.medium AWS instance.
projects.title: FTP2S3 Proxy as a Service Project

experience.title: South Jersey Area Director

summary:
Being raised in a small town in South Jersey (Audubon) with five boys, we had a built-in basketball team right under our roof. Although I played all sports growing up, I gravitated towards basketball. That enabled me to join the LaSalle Explorers in 1981-82 as an incoming freshmen. Although a severe ankle injury curtailed my playing time as a freshmen, it also turned out to be a blessing in disguise. After doing much soul searching and trying to figure out what life was all about, in the spring of 1982, I cried out to a God I wasnt sure existed. I asked Jesus Christ to forgive me of my destructive life and sin, and asked Him to take over my life. THE BEST DAY OF MY LIFE! I became a new person (2 Corith 5:17) that day. That decision to turn my life over to Christ and give Him the keys to the steering wheel of my life; has enabled me to fufill my destiny and calling the last 32 years.

 I graduated in 1985. Then got married in 1986 and have 2 beautiful girls. I went into the restaurant business in 1989 for 8 years. I always served in church life no matter where we were living. In 1994, I joined the Saints Prison Ministry, the largest athletic prison ministry in the US, and have been in over 200 prisons playing basketball and sharing the gospel of Jesus Christ. That ministry experience brought to the forefront the desire to minister full time. In 1997, I became a Full-time missionary with the Fellowship of Christian Athletes, serving as the South Jersey Area Director for FCA. Working with FCA has opened numerous doors in schools and communities, but it also opened another door. In 2001-02, I began as the Philadelphia 76ers team chaplain and having been serving in the NBA the last 13 years. It has been an absolutely amazing journey which started because of God's unconditional love for a rebellious young teen. I thank Him everyday that He had a plan and purpose for my life.

experience.description: My title has been affectionately called "the store mom" by my coworkers. My dailly responsibilities most demandingly require me to be the one who always double-checks, and remembers what others may forget. I manage the many details of running a high-volume, fast-paced restaurant and ensure we as a team provide an unparalleled guest experience. I prepare catering orders, assign routes for/check in with drivers to ensure timely and professional execution of deliveries. I am responsible for ordering store supplies each day, processing large orders, and communicating with kitchen management to ensure adequate supplies and flawless timing. I manage payroll, consolidate store daily deposits, and I am the primary communicator with regular catering customers to ensure their experience was exceptional, and that they are excited to use Tacodeli again in the future. In addition to my many responsibilities that ensure catering business is conducted such that it reflects the excellent reputation of Tacodeli, in tandem I am the primary "eyes on the ground" in staff management during business hours. My immaculate attention to detail, strong interpersonal and leadership skills, and ability to manage my time are constantly on display. During our busiest hours our customer volume can reach 3-4 checks per each of three registers per minute. Our business can feel quite overwhelming at times but I am confident in my ability to manage every crisis with a smile.

headline: Princess at being a full time princess <3
Owner & President of Big Mountain Inc
summary:
A philosophy of life . . .


 My family loves the Pacific Northwest (including the family dog & cat), and my wife, Jamie, and I are passionate about this place where our children (Noah, Logan, & Aislinn) grow and learn. We live on a small farm set against the backdrop of the Cascade Mountains and spend much of our time raising and growing our own food — Scottish Highland Cattle, ducks, and chickens as well as gardens and fruit trees. These are the fixtures of our landscape, and from them emerges our passion for hard work, beauty, and sustainability. These are also the fundamentals of Big Mountain Construction (BMC).

 Big Mountain Construction is committed to meet the unique and imaginative needs of our clients. Be it a peaceful artist’s retreat; a Mountain lodge; a carefully crafted one room, island getaway; or a elegant dream home overlooking the Bay, we look forward to working with you!

 Rest assured, whether the project be big or small, we have the experience and the creativity to do the job. We want to build something both you and Big Mountain Construction can be proud of.

 So, we hope you’ll give us that chance!

experience.description:
Our Mission
 Quality, Passion, and Pride Are Just Words
 (Except When They Become a Mission)

 At Ruby Tuesday, we turn words into action, and we also turn them into our mission. Quality, passion, and pride drive our business because they drive each of us.

 Quality is fresh 100% USDA Choice or Prime ground beef formed into perfectly grilled, handcrafted burgers that redefine an American classic. Quality is seasonal vine-ripened tomatoes and crisp, just-picked leaf lettuce. It's smoke-cured bacon and premium cheeses. It's an uncompromising commitment to providing you the best.

 Passion is about people who love what they do and take your enjoyment and satisfaction personally. Passion is what to expect from the people who take your order, the people who craft your meal (and peek out from the kitchen to see your delight), and the people who make our comfortable, stylish restaurants destinations in themselves. Everyone you meet here is happy you've come, and they're genuinely dedicated to having you visit us often.

 Pride makes us a family. When we are at work, this is our home, and you are our guest. We attend to your dining experience with a degree of care and attention to detail unrivaled anywhere. A deep desire to serve others is the secret weapon of a gracious host, and it's why, at Ruby Tuesday, we want you to always leave with a smile.

volunteering.description: Established in 1991 in Houston, Texas, Chinese Youth Camp has since evolved and grown into two separate entities which service two important Chinese American metropolitan areas (DFW and Houston). DFW Chinese Youth Camp offers a unique six day experience for children and young adults between the ages of 8-18. We offer a balance of Chinese culture and leadership/problem solving skills enrichment, which campers will be able to apply to their present and future lifestyles. Our camp’s primary goal is to educate young Americans the importance of Chinese cultural roots and how these cultural roots manifest in their daily lives. To build leadership skills, problem solving and confidence through activities they do not normally see in school. Our camp is unique in the range of classes/activities we offer. The camp experience not only includes an introduction to Chinese Culture (such as Chinese yo-yo folk dancing, painting, arts & crafts, calligraphy) but also group activities like the banquet, carnival, and talent show. Each year, we invite teachers from Taiwan to join our camp to teach some core Chinese cultural classes. Each teacher is a master in his/her respective cultural subject and delivers a more enhanced learning experience to our campers. Additionally, we have a pool of local talented teachers who teach classes such as STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics), hip hop dance, kung fu, basketball and film. http://chineseyouthcamp.com

summary:
Many companies are realizing that creating a relationship with a bank is easy - it's creating a relationship with a banker that's the trick. I customize strategies for your business that will matter when YOU need them the MOST.

 Business banking and loan strategies are critical, and it can be hard to find a bank that will value your company today and tomorrow. Comerica Bank approaches business owners in a different way, a personal way. I can put solutions in place that will improve the collection of your cash flow and prolong the disbursements of your payables.

 Control over your financial position combined with a strong relationship increases your visibility in the marketplace. At Comerica, we listen to the client and tailor creative and innovative solutions that fit the particular needs of our clients as opposed to a “one size fits all approach”.

 Specialties: Commercial loans including real estate, lines of credit, equipment loans, construction lending, business expansions, partners buy in / buy out. Additional specialties include, treasury management solutions, SBA 7(a), SBA 504, Export Working Capital Loans, International Trade Export Loans and portfolio management.

 Mission Statement:
 A Bank’s job by definition is returning people's belongings better than they found it; whether it be interest on their deposits, or growing their business. A bank is human at its core because those that ethically practice this ideology are bound together by something more powerful and distinctive: an unwavering commitment to each other.

 I believe that our character and values define our working experience, not the other way around, and this is what forms the foundation of a unique, caring and collaborative culture.

 I believe that this appreciation for our relationships with customers and colleagues will serve to distinguish us from other financial institutions.

 I believe that in this way, every day, we are raising the expectations of what a bank can be.
